author: Special Correspondent
text:
The members of Jain community taking out a rally in connection with the kumbabishekam of Shree Adinath Swetambar Jain Naya Mandir in Salem on Saturday.- Photo: E. Lakshmi Narayanan

: A large number of men and women belonging to Jain community participated in a rally taken out in the city on the eve of the kumbabishekam of the Shree Adinath Swetambar Jain Naya Mandir, a Jain Temple at Sankarnagar, here on Sunday.

Kumbabishekam

The Kumbabishekam of the temple is scheduled on Sunday and Acharya Geenotam Siriswarji, Chief Acharya, who has come down from Bengaluru, will perform the same.

The men, women and children in colourful attire participated in the rally, which commenced form the temple premises.

They walked through the Hasthampatti main road, Gandhi road, Ramakrishna Mutt road, Four roads, Anna Park junction before returning back to the temple.

Acharya Geenotam Siriswarji participated in the rally along with his disciples and A.Hastimal, president, Shree Parshwanath Jain Trust, S. Rashiklal, its secretary and others. The Jain community members pulled a decorated temple car in the rally.

A dozen horses and decorated chariots were at the head of the procession.
title: Temple festival: Jains take out rally
